It enters the world as a replica of its adult form, only four thousand times smaller. Built for the Kill: Crocodile follows the transformation of a tiny hatchling into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The hyena, much maligned and misunderstood, is no slobbering scavenger. It's a calculating killer: as smart as a primate, as lethal as a lion. programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The killer whale is the world's biggest dolphin-32 feet long and up to six tons heavy. Smart, sophisticated, and social, they live in groups and hunt cooperatively. programme.title: Built For The Kill

programme.title: Built For The Kill

programme.title: Super Reefs
programme.desc: In 2009, National Geographic Pristine Seas explored the southern Line Islands and found pristine coral reefs, thriving ecosystems teeming with sharks and huge schools of fish. But in 2015-16, an unprecedented ocean warming event killed half of the corals. The Pristine Seas team returned in 2021, hoping to see some signs of recovery. What they found instead was the most spectacular recovery of coral reefs ever witnessed.

programme.desc: The killer whale is the world's biggest dolphin-32 feet long and up to six tons heavy. Smart, sophisticated, and social, they live in groups and hunt cooperatively. But it's no natural born killer. Calves spend several years at their mother's side, learning how to hunt some of the smallest-and biggest-animals in the sea. Built for the Kill: Killer Whale exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The big bad wolf is 100 pounds of muscle and teeth, but it's born blind, deaf and weighs just one pound. Built for the Kill: Wolf follows the transformation of a helpless pup into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The wolf hones its hunting skills over about two years of intensive training-and the lessons are hard.
